page.title: 11Educational Opportunities
page.content: Education in the villages is provided up to 11 years of age by the state . In the academic year the children attain 12, they commence {secondary education.}In the Canterbury area, this is a{selective system where 25% of the children are chosen for an accelerated programme of work at one of Canterbury's 4 selective schools and the remainder go to a local non-selective schools which include Church, Secondary Modern and Bi-lateral schools. An element of {parental choice}is intended in the system but usually non-selective children attend their nearest school unless parents are members of a denomination which provides education. Petham children{travel}to their near -est non-selective school at Chartham by special coach while selective pupils use the bus service or cars.
